articles.title: Boat That Sparked Scare Belongs To Australian: Maharashtra Minister
articles.description: Maharashtra's Deputy Chief Minister Devendra Fadnavis has said the boat carrying three AK-47s belongs to an Australian couple who abandoned it after engine trouble. Prima facie, there is no terror angle, but it is unclear why it was carrying arms.
articles.content:
• The damaged boat was found near Harihareshwar Beach in Raigad, 190 km from Mumbai,  by fishermen. Three AK-47 rifles, bullets and documents were found on it.

articles.title: What Nitish Kumar Said On Reunion With Lalu Yadav In Patna Last Night
articles.description: Nitish Kumar met Lalu Yadav for the first time since their parties reunited last week to form a new government in Bihar. "We were together and we will stay together," the Bihar Chief Minister told reporters this morning.

articles.title: BJP MLAs, 'Untruthful' Godhra Train Attack Witness Were on Panel Which Released Bilkis Convicts
articles.description: The committee has a total of four members associated with the BJP, including Murli Mulchandani whose testimony as a prosecution witness in the Godhra train attack was disbelieved by the trial court.

articles.title: Non-locals in J&K get voting rights, Opposition says 'imported voters' will help BJP
articles.description: The Centre has allowed non-locals living in Jammu and Kashmir to register as voters. The move has been slammed by Mehbooba Mufti and Omar Abdullah, who claimed it will only help BJP to 'import fake voters' to vote for the saffron party.
